projects.title: Modern Hillside Home
description: Perched on a scenic hillside in Livingston, this modern home was designed to blend seamlessly with its natural surroundings while offering expansive views of the city below. The residence faces west.

The residence features a minimalist design, utilizing raw concrete, glass, and natural wood elements. The open-concept living spaces are designed to maximize natural light and provide a seamless transition between indoor and outdoor environments â€” including a stunning infinity pool that enhances the contextual landscape.
features: Minimalist design with raw concrete and natural wood
Cantilevered structure with large open living spaces
Custom-designed infinity pool overlooking the cityscape
Floor-to-ceiling glass walls and sliding doors
Outdoor living area with fire pit and lounge space
Integrated landscape design with native plantings

projects.title: Minimalist Lake House
description: This lakeside retreat embodies simplicity and connection to nature. Designed as a weekend escape, the home features clean lines and an emphasis on horizontal planes that mirror the calm waters of the lake.

Natural materials including stone, wood, and glass create a warm, inviting atmosphere while maintaining a refined aesthetic. The design prioritizes indoor-outdoor living with expansive terraces and floor-to-ceiling windows.

projects.title: Urban Office Renovation
description: A comprehensive renovation of a mid-century office building in Manhattan's Flatiron District. The design preserves the building's original concrete structure while introducing modern amenities and flexible workspace solutions.

The open-plan layout incorporates collaborative zones, quiet work areas, and versatile meeting spaces. Exposed materials and a restrained material palette create an atmosphere of focused productivity.
features: Exposed concrete ceiling and structural elements
Flexible meeting rooms with movable partitions
Acoustic treatments for improved sound quality

projects.title: Hillside Retreat
description: A secluded residence nestled into a wooded hillside, designed to minimize site impact while maximizing views. The home features a split-level design that follows the natural topography.
Sustainable materials and passive solar design strategies reduce energy consumption while maintaining year-round comfort.

projects.title: Contemporary Addition
description: A modern addition to a 1960s suburban home that creates new living spaces while respecting the original structure. The design uses contrasting materials to distinguish new from old.
The addition includes an expanded kitchen, family room, and primary suite, all organized around a central courtyard that brings natural light deep into the plan.

projects.title: Modern Townhouse Renovation
description: A gut renovation of a 19th-century Brooklyn townhouse that preserves the historic facade while creating a completely modern interior. The design opens up the traditional layout to create flowing, light-filled spaces.
A new skylight above the central stairwell brings natural light to all levels. Custom millwork and built-ins maximize storage in the narrow footprint.
